components.description:
The universal recycling symbol, featuring three arrows pointing clockwise in a triangular formation.

The word “black” in the official name is due to this emoji existing as a unicode character before the current standardized emoji set.
components.title: Black Universal Recycling Symbol

description:
The universal recycling symbol, featuring three arrows pointing clockwise in a triangular formation.

The word “black” in the official name is due to this emoji existing as a unicode character before the current standardized emoji set.
title: Black Universal Recycling Symbol

version.description:
The following characters we added to Unicode in 2002, with many given emoji presentation status in the years 2010-2015.

Those given emoji presentation status by Unicode were part of Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

emoji_net_data.definition: The universal recycling symbol, featuring three arrows pointing clockwise in a triangular formation. The word “black” in the official name i http://emojipedia.org/black-universal-recycling-symbol/
emoji_net_data.name: recycling symbol

bn:00750208n: A symbol universally associated with recyclable materials. It is comprised of three crooked arrows arranged as a triangular clockwise Möbius strip.
The universal recycling symbol is an internationally recognized symbol used to designate recyclable materials.
Symbol used to designate recyclable materials

bn:00057017n: The phenomena of the physical world, and also to life in general
Nature, in the broadest sense, is equivalent to the natural, physical, or material world or universe.

Nature, derived from the Latin word natura, for "essential qualities, innate disposition", and in ancient times, this literally referred to "birth"; in a broader sense, it has been applied to the entire physical or material world, and in some mystical or metaphysical uses to realms of relationships beyond these.
The set of all natural systems, including the air, land, water, and living things other than humans.
The summary of everything that has to do with biological, chemical and physical states and events in the physical universe.
The natural physical world including plants and animals and landscapes etc.
Phenomena of the physical world, and also to life in general

bn:00035670n: Food waste or food loss is food that is discarded or cannot be used.
A container into which things are discarded.
Food that is discarded (as from a kitchen)
Waste generated by residential households and comprised of any material no longer wanted or needed.
Unwanted or undesired material, usually discarded.
Municipal solid waste, commonly known as trash or garbage, refuse or rubbish is a waste type consisting of everyday items that are discarded by the public.

bn:00053450n: A perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent (as a visible clue that something has happened)
A perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent, as a visible clue that something has happened.

bn:00005896n: A mark to indicate a direction or relation
A mark to indicate a direction or relation.
A sign or symbol used to indicate a direction (e.g. \to).

bn:00068465n: Metal material discarded during manufacturing or processing operations which cannot be directly fed back into the operation.
Scrap consists of recyclable materials left over from product manufacturing and consumption, such as parts of vehicles, building supplies, and surplus materials.
Discarded or waste material; rubbish, trash.
The recycling of metals including iron
Municipal solid waste, commonly known as trash or garbage, refuse or rubbish is a waste type consisting of everyday items that are discarded by the public.
Items or material that have been discarded.
Collectively, items or material that have been discarded; rubbish, garbage.
Worthless material that is to be disposed of
Unwanted or undesired material, usually discarded.

bn:00066628n: The act of processing used or abandoned materials for use in creating new products

Recycling is a process to change waste materials into new products to prevent waste of potentially useful materials, reduce the consumption of fresh raw materials, reduce energy usage, reduce air pollution and water pollution by reducing the need for "conventional" waste disposal, and lower greenhouse gas emissions as compared to plastic production.
Process using materials into new products to prevent waste of potentially useful materials

A method of recovering wastes as resources which includes the collection, and often involving the treatment, of waste products for use as a replacement of all or part of the raw material in a manufacturing process.
The practice of sorting and collecting waste materials for new use.
A resource recovery method involving the collection and treatment of a waste product for use as raw material in the manufacture of the same or a similar product.
